titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 1. VI. Bathing rock.

list.item: Bailey— J. About Conover— Consulate. Judiciary Bill.
Randolph. Beverley— Navy-Yard Agency.
Rush— S.T— Hopkinson. C. J. Ingersoll &c. about Thomson’s tea
Russell. B— Visit from Boston for Health—
Mitchell. A. C— Applies for Navy Agency at the Yard.
White— Jos. M— Register and Receiver in Florida. Leg: Covent
Thomas J. B— Of Kane, Holmes, Dickerson, & Hamtramck
Clay— S.S— Resignation of R. King. Despatches from Colombia
Mrs A. Evening party at Mrs Clay’s.

div.p: 2. VI. College hill.

list.item: Baker. D.— Paid first of his four annual Notes 318

list.head: Surveyor General of Pennsylvania. They recommend P. Markley as Collr. Phila And thinks Hiester, Steele shd. be removed

Come. Morris arrived at N.Y. from England.
Conner is a visitor from New-Jersey
list.item: Southard. S.N.
Rush. S.T. Letter to Glentworth Surveyor Phila. Reprimand
Webster— D. Judiciary Bill— White of Tenee against J. Williams
Barbour— S.W. After waiting some time retired.
B. Russell— symbols Mrs Adams & nieces at T. B. Johnson’s
Sprague— Panama Mission, and Judiciary Bill.

div.p: 3. VI. Tyber Square

list.item: Lowrie. Resns. of S. Confirmations of Appts. two Indian Treaties

list.head: To plead for Coll. Talbot Chambers, cashiered by a Court-Martial— Can he be restored?
Bringham, from Mexico, with a Letter from Poinsett— Cambreleng immediately withdrew

list.item: White— Jos. M. Recommendations. Regr. and Receiver Florida

list.head: Of German extraction, from York Pennsylvania with a load of whiskey and Oats
list.item: Smeisser and

list.head: Visits— Bibb, a brother of G. M, but from F. Johnson’s District— Says he brings him comfort.
list.item: Bibb.
Barbour S.W. Cadle’s Court Martial— Panama Instrns

list.head: Panama Mission; to go immediately— Blythe a Professor at Transylvania— Visitor at West-Point
list.item: Clay— S.S.—
Southard S.N— Lexington Corvette— Gamble’s claim to Brent
Welles— John— with his family and visitors from Boston
Last drawing room for the Season
Taylor J. W— Senate adhere to amendment of judiciary bill

div.p: 4. V. Bath in Potowmack

list.item: Hunter. J. W— Urgent importunity for the Navy-Yard Office

list.head: Visits— Presbyterian Clergymen from Virginia going to the general meeting at Philadelphia

list.item: Moore. From Alexa. Petn. to remit Stripes for Weston. Larceny
Patterson— Edgar— Solicitation for the Navy-yard Office. urgent
M’Intyre Alexander— Solicitation for employment— Patent Office

list.head: Visits— Former Member H.R. from Virginia, and Revolutionary Officer.
Visits— To certify character in favour of Timothy Savage, Middletown— I spoke of Bristol as judge
Visits— Mr Carnahan is President of Princeton College— Vacation there now 5 weeks.

list.item: Morris. Chs— Returned from Europe— His tour. Chronometer
Lang— To apply for Brevet upon Brevet for Major Gamble

list.head: Visits— Croghan is appointed Inspector Genl and comes now from New-Orleans
Comee. with eight Bills and one Resn. All Signed.

list.item: Clay S.S. Proceedings of Slave Indemnity Commission.
Thomas. Jesse B— Anxious for the fate of the judiciary Bill.

Vote of several Senators against Hamtramck. Tazewell said P.U.S. had stated to a Virginian recommending another Candidate, that 40. Senators had recommended Hamtramck— Woodbury asked, who had sent the Senatorial recommendations to the Senate?— Kane said he had obtained them.

div.p: 5. VI:45. Half hours walk.

list.item: Lowrie S.U.S.— Convention with Denmark. Advice & Consent
Marks— To plead for Captain Pentland, cashiered.
Moore Alr. from Alexa. Order to remit Weston’s stripes
Gamble— For Commission Brevet of Lt. Coll upon Brevet.
Moore of Phila— Revolutionary Officer— A visitor

list.head: Member H.R. from Pa.— Visits— Russell is Inhabitant of Adams County.
Visits— Mr Appleton recently from Boston
Patterson a boy of 14. from Baltimore, who wishes for a Midshipman’s Warrant

list.item: Barbour S.W— For nomination of D. Brearley. Message S.U.S. N. 41.
Brown— Genl.— Of M’Lean P.M.G. and New-York Politics
Company to dine—
Connell— John— Evening— Mrs Adams unwell— Party at Barrell’s

div.p: 6. V. over Tyber, round by P. Bridge, and central Market.

list.item: Graham— G— Procns. Sales of Lands in Louisiana. Two. signed
Anderson. Joseph. His affairs with Cathcart— And about his Sons

list.head: Visitors from Brookville, Montgomery Co. Maryland

list.item: Whittlesey— Resignn. of Williams Sundusky— Pardon for R. Eaton.
Kent— Govr.— To recommend G. Taylor and Hunter
Bell— Saml.— Promised to call again Monday.
Lowrie— Advice and Consent to appt of Callaway. Marshal. E. Tenee
Thomas. J. B. and Hamtramck— Left cards. I was engaged

list.head: Visitors.
Cabinet Meeting— Slave Indemnity Commns Question of Interest— English wish to break up Commission— Brevets on Brevets—
list.item: Clay S.S.
Rush S.T.
Barbour S.W.
Southard S.N.

div.p: 7. IV:45. Sun rose 5:1. Over N.W. Edge of State Dept.

list.item: Heard Little— Hebrews 8:10.

list.head: Visits— Belt in the Post-Office— Applies for the Agency at the Navy-Yard.
list.item: Belt. Judge, of Ohio

list.head: Visits— Contestablo from Greece— Disappointed that Commodore Rodgers did not aid them
Visits— Morier British Commissioner to Mexico. Returning thence to England.

list.item: Taylor J. W— Against Gallatin’s going to England as Minr.
Miss Mease, to dine
Met Crowninshield— He walked with me to Church.
Little— Hebrews Acts 2:22.

div.p: 8. IV:45. Sun rose 5— Swam in Potowmack— 22 Minutes

list.item: Bell— Calhoun’s symbols Coalition of Servile and Democrat. D. Clinton

list.head: Visitors from Pennsylvania. Mrs White wishes to visit Mrs Adams
Visitors— Preston from Estill’s District in Virginia

list.item: Hebb— Applies for the Agency at Navy-Yard. Maryland Recommns.
Gamble— For his Brevet Lieutt Colonelcy— Going away
Blunt. Edmund. For Employment as a Coast Surveyor.

list.head: Visits— Huntington Distt. Atty Connectt. recommends warmly Daggett for District Judge

list.item: Rush. S.T— Letter from C. J. Ingersoll—of Thompson’s Teas Nevins’s
Clay S.S. His conversation with L. Cheves— Slave Indy. Commn.
Day absorbed by visitors— Conversation with Bell particular.
Effort in New-Hampshire to raise a democratic opposition subservient to the Slave-infected Southern policy.
Mrs Adams attended an Evening party at Mrs Barbour’s

div.p: 9. V:30. Swam in Potomack 30 minutes.

list.item: Lowrie. 2. Resns. S. advising to appointments.
Cranch. W. Judge— Court in Session— began yesterday. For G. Taylor
Wertz— To be Justice of Peace 4th. Ward— For consideration
Wallace. Dr. with Letter from F. Johnson— For Navy Yard Agency.
Sanford. N. For Letter from S. Wright to Seymour. Returned it to him.
Cameron. Editor of the Pennsylvania Intelligencer. Harrisburg
Hackley— Aaron. Collector at Ogdensburg— Navigation of St. Lawrence
Huntington. Distt. Atty.Wirt’s opinion in his case copy. Daggatt for Dist Judge
Garnett R & Mrs— He walks with aid of a Servant. Thinks he is con. . .

list.head: Visitors— three whose names I could not ascertain— Spoke of the Creek Treaty-Bill which passed H.R. this day—with protest against it of the Georgia members.
list.item: Dorsey.
Dorsey.
Rives. W. C. Apply for pardon of Ballou, who stole from the mail—
Brent— D—J. Sergeant declines going to Panama in the Summer
Tomlinson— Recommendation of D. Burrows— Surveyor, Middletown
Clay S.S. Note to Vaughan— Impressment of 2 Seamen— Sergeant. Livingstn.
Southard. S.N— Recomns. for Agency at Navy-Yard. 30. Candidates
Blank Patents— Single 30. Double 10 = 40

div.p: 10. V:15. Capitol— Drizzling rain

list.item: Lowrie S.U.S. Advice. Trimble, judge S.C. Alp. Wetmore Paymaster
Hunter. J. W. For the Navy Yard Office

list.head: To recommend judge Belt for the Navy-yard Office
To recommend Captain R. M. Kirby for a brevet Major’s Commission— Left his Letter with me
Visits— Mr Moore not dissatisfied with the nomination of W. Crawford as District judge, Alabama
list.item: Moore of Ala
Dorsey Clemt— To recommend Hebb, (a Relation) for the Navy-Yard Office

list.head: Visits— Clay remained— To write to Sergeant, urging his acceptance— Instructions as revised—
list.item: Clay S.S.

list.head: Visits— Dr Hosack, on a tour from New-York
list.item: Hosask.
Wool Coll. Retd. from Inspection— Urges for a Brevet Commission
Connell. J. Visit from Wilmington Delaware— Claims on France

list.head: Visits— Letcher says both parties in Kentucky are sanguine of success at their next election.

list.item: Ingersoll. Edward. From Philadelphia, visit of a few days.
White— Jos. M— Remonstrances agt.R H. Love, and W. H. Allen—
Cook. D. P— Land-Office Illinois— Judiciary Bill— Amendmt. Pres: Eln.

list.head: Visits— Smith a Son of John Smith of N.Y. sometime S.U.S.

list.item: Chilicothe. Ohio 2. L.G.

div.p: 11. V:45. To foot of College Hill

list.item: Lowrie— S.U.S— 2. Resns. Advising to Appointments.
Orr. from Pennsylvania—
Wertz— To enquire, if a Justice of Peace— 4th. ward will be appointed.
Ramsay. Mrs V— Her misfortunes and her Son’s. Returned her Letter.
Southard S.N. Vincennes Corvette— For Carthagena, or Labrador
Mease. Miss, with Mrs Featherstonhaugh and her Son
Rush— S.T— Appointments Regr. and Receiver Florida— R. H. Love
Law— Thomas— To recommend Hebb, for the Navy-Yard Office
Barbour S.W. New Creek Treaty-Bill altered in Senate— Agt. the Treaty.
Thomas J. B. Very anxious for the Judiciary Bill
Pearce D. J— Of Southern feelings and policy.
Bailey— Judson’s wish to be attached to the Panama Mission as Surgeon.

div.p: 12. V:20. Rock— Met P. Adams— Machine for raising Water by Steam

list.item: Hunter— J. W— Solicitations for appt of Navy-Store keeper
Brent. W. L— Appt of Surveyor Genl Louisiana— Nicholas— Creole— an objn.

list.head: To recommend Thomas Miller for Navy Store-keeper— remarks concerning E. Patterson— Miller’s Misfortunes

list.item: O’Brien Jer. Sloop of War to protect the Fisheries. Surveyor at Bath

list.head: Applying for Surveys to be made in Indiana this Summer. Ansr. of Secy of War to them— They wish Shriver— Douglas E Florida

list.item: Bomford. Coll.— Recomg. Coll. Hunter for the Navy Store keeper’s Office
Rush. S.T. Discharge of H. Crawford— On payment of Costs added
Tutt. E. P. Accepts the Creek Indian Agency— Waits for something more permanent.
Calvert— To sail next week for England; from Philadelphia.
Barbour— S.W. Brevet Commissions— Wool. Totten— Bernard
Thomas J. B. Judiciary Bill falling through— Comee. H.R. agt. amendt
Clay S.S. Joseph Ray’s complaints. E. Barry. Bail for Ortega to be released
Rush again. . . . Commns. of W. Joyner and J. D. Jones.
Hopkinson Dr. John— To dine, and lodges here.
Featherstonhaugh Mr and Mrs— to Spend eve— I did not see them.

div.p: 13. V. Rock opposite Mason’s Island

list.item: Miller— Thomas, for the Navy Store keeper’s Office
Crowninshield. Judiciary Bill— Likely to fail— He will vote for it

list.head: Visits Spoke of time wasted in speaking— The Senatorial project of absorbing patronage
list.item: Coombs. From Ky
Broom— Major— for the Navy Store keeper’s Office
White Jos. M. Remonstrating agt. appointmt. of R. H. Love
Clowes Isaac— Present of 3. ears of Indian Corn— Inventor from Hampton
Eckford. Henry— from New-York— Launched a ship at Baltimore
Everett— of the Judiciary Bill— Websters Rept and dissatisfaction
Southard. S.N. a Lieutt. in Marine Corps— Neville— Navy-Yard Store keeper.
Ironside. G. E. Treaty with Denmark. Ratified copy to sign

list.head: Comee with 7. Acts. 1. jt. Resn. to sign— Signed all but two Acts, reserved for further Consideration.

list.item: Barbour S.W. Coll.Wool’s and other applications for Brevets.
Bouligny. With Letter from Villerè recomn. of Nicholas as Surveyor— La.
Crowninshield. Judiciary Bill— Considn. in H.R. postponed to Monday
Taylor J. W. Asks me to converse with Webster on the Judiciary Bill

div.p: 14. V:15. Walk round back Square.

list.item: Heard Little Revns. 3.4. A few names in Sardis
Featherstonhaugh— Going to England. Canals and Railways
Webster— Judiciary Bill— He will move recomn. Suppg Bill
Heard— Crocker at Hawleys. Cor
Cook. D. P.— Scott will decline re-election to oppose the Adminn
Holmes— John— uncertain if he will be candidate for re-election

list.head: Roman Catholics in his District, offended with the Message— Religious intolerance.

list.item: Merwin— Distt. Judge Connt. Bristol. Postmaster Hartford.
Collector Middletown soon— Tomlinson to be Governor.

div.p: 15. IV:45. Sun rose 4.53. Line of N. Chimney. Brick house— Same 29. July— Swam 33 minutes— Out 1 hour 38 minutes.

list.item: Hunter. J. W. Sturdy Beggar for Office— Referred to Southard

list.head: Visits— Counter Letters White and J. S. Barbour concerning R. H. Love— Barbour’s remarks if the appointmt should make enemies to the Admn. so much the better.
list.item: Downing.—
Rush. S.T.— Judge Van Ness’s decision upon the teas.
Graham G.— to write to Mr L Lee— Excuse for passing over Love

list.head: Huger returning to S. Carolina from the North where his Son has been at School— Another Son here last Summer with La Fayette.

list.item: Thomas. J. B— Kane’s Letter— Visitor at W. Point. Kane & Govr B.
Brown— Genl—Wool. Totten. Brevets. Swift’s Reappointmt.

list.head: About a claim of Armstrong for keeping negroes— Papers from the Navy Departmt.
list.item: Armstrong Marshal
Armstrong— Andrew— Returning to Hayti. Wishes to be transferred
Clay. S.S. Papers from L. Cheves— Instns. to Rochester

list.head:
H. from Pennsylvania— With M’Neily for a visit.
Judiciary Bill— Considn. postponed till tomorrow
Left a paper requesting, the Surveys in the State of Maine may be extended further than the Senators desire

list.item: Ingersoll. E— Prosing.

list.head: Comee. 3. Bills to sign.
list.item: Garnsey.
Knight below

div.p: 16. IV:10. Swam 45 Minutes— out 2. hours

list.item: Lowe— A contribution for Oxenhill Church 10 miles off.
O’Brien Jerh: Surveyor at Eastport S. Ayer— Objn. to Re-appointmt
Harrison. Genl. Recommends Walton for Marshal Key West &c

list.head:
Hendricks’s Letters to be returned to him. copies taken
Applies for Superintendency of Capitol—an Office to be
list.item: Lowe

list.head: Genl. Lyman visits from Northampton— Never at Washington before. Mills had returned
Comee. with 14 Bills to sign all private. Signed.

list.item: Huntington. Grief that D. Daggett is not nomd Distt. judge

list.head:
Visits from Baltimore
Judiciary Bill indefinitely postponed

Evening visits— Taliaferro is from Virginia.
Tazewell promised frequent social visits

list.item: Seymour. H. His Colleague Chase— W. C. Bradley. Govr Clinton.

div.p: 17. V. Diving Rock, with John— Swam an hour

list.head: Visits— Morehead from Ohio— Beecher much against the abortive judiciary Bill. Ohio electioneering struggle.

list.item: Schee— Applies for a Consular Appointment or Secy Legation— Naudain

list.head: Walker of the Society of Friends: from Pennsylvania
Cabinet Meeting— Discussion upon Applications for Brevets— Gallant Conduct— Ten years— Genl. Scott’s recommendations— Principles to be settled. Whole Subject postponed till next Session of Congress.
Comee. with 14. Bills— Signed

list.item: Message to both Houses. N. with 18. Indian Treaties.
Company to dine—
Huntt. Mr and Mrs.Lyman Genl. and Lee. W— this Eve. Faht. 90.

div.p: 18. V— Rock near Bridge— Swam 50 minutes— Out 2 hours

list.head: Visits— Reiter is from Philadelphia— Urgently recommend P. S. Markley for Collector, Legislators of Pa.

list.item: Bell. S. To take leave— Prospects in New-Hampshire—
Rush S.T. Letter from Lacock in Alabama— Forfeitures & Customs

list.head: Kentucky members to take leave

list.item: of Ohio— going

list.head: T.t.l— New-York Members— Prospects— Clay and Clinton

list.item: Graham G— Proclamn. for Sales of Land in Louisiana. Time in Blank

list.head: Visits
list.item: Newbold. From N.Y.
Dix. J. A— To go as Messenger, to Copenhagen with Danish Treaty.

list.head: Visits
list.item: Boyd. of N.Y

list.head: T.t.L. Going home to Kentucky

list.item: Tingey— To recommend appt of Booth to the Navy-Yard Office
symbols 15 3/4 symbols
Brent. D— With power to Rainals to Exchange Ratns. Danish Treaty
Noble— James— For copy of his Letter to me, to give Jonn. Jennings

list.head: Mr Jefferson’s grandson; now from Boston, with Letter of Introduction from his grandfather

list.item: Morsell— Wants a place. Brought recommendatory Letters
Webster— T.t.L. going Saturday Morning for Boston

div.p: 19. V. Rock near Bridge Swam 57. Minutes. Out 2. hours 5 minutes

list.item: Wickliffe— To take leave— About returning to Kentucky
Wilson— twice— for discharge of from prison— Order
Robinson Jeremy— for place; with certificates and recommendation.
Macon. Nathl.— To take leave— Grateful for Mrs A’s notice when he was sick.
Barbour S.W— Abused in Congress, about the Creek Treaty.
Southard S.N— Despatches from Com. Hull in the Pacific

list.head: Members from Pennsylvania to take leave
Members from Ohio

list.item: Clay S.S.— Despatches to send by Dix— And Instrns. to R. C. Anderson
Webster’s Son— For Packet to Vanderkemp; deliverable to Storrs at N.Y.
Clarke— H.R. with Sloane’s Resolution.
Gallatin— Arrived from Baltimore— St. Lawrence, and Maine Boundary
Dwight. T.t.l— Stays to the close— Creek Treaty debate— H.R.
Dix— T.t.l— Going to-morrow for Copenhagen; with the Treaty.

div.p: 20. V:20. Swam to and through the Bridge. 45 minutes

list.item: Patterson Edgar— Applies again for the Navy-Yard Department
Cameron— for Bachelor— imprisoned for debt

list.head: Visits— V. B. makes enquiries concerning my father’s health— Also concerning R. King.

list.item: Selden Cary.— Applies for the Navy-yard Storekeepers Office—
Pearce. Dutee J— Failure of judiciary Bill— Will call again
Sampson— Applies for Pardon of Morehead—which was issued

list.head: Comee. Brought the Bills and 1. Resn. signed. wished if they should bring no more I would go to the Capitol.
Called in the afternoon
list.item: Clay. S.S.
Rush S.T
Southard—

div.p: Southard, my Son John and Dr Hopkinson went with me at 7 P.M. to the Capitol— Senate were balloting for a President. after 19 Ballotings— N. Macon was elected— Hayne told Rush there was sensibility, at members of the Cabinet being present, upon which Clay, Rush and Southard, went in to the Senate chamber—purposely. Ingham afterwards told Southard, he had heard Mr Tazewell had remarked aloud, that the Senate could elect their President without company—and added that he was glad he Southard had not been there, and sorry that Rush was there— Southard said he told Ingham that whoever had made the remark, it was a great piece of impertinence— I signed 65 Bills there and at 10 minutes after Midnight left the Capitol and came home— Mr Rush taking the place with me of Southard— At 12:45 I retired much fatigued to bed.

list.item: Heard Little— Job. 33.26— On Prayer.
Trimble D. t.t.l— Says he is entirely satisfied. Going home.
Thunder Shower— prevented attendance at Church—P.M.

list.head: Comee. with 14 Bills and one Resolution—

list.item: Gallatin— A— from Baltimore— Negotn. with England. St. Lawrence
Everett. E—Sloane’s Resolution— Boston Politics in confusion

div.p: 22. V— Swam below Van Ness’s house with John. Boat gone.

list.item: Sands— Joshua— letter from my father— Swift Surveyor N.Y. recomd.
Taliaferro J.— Takes leave— going homeward this morning.
Southard S.N. went up to the Capitol with him.
Ward— of N.York— to take leave.
Whittlesey— Same— case of R. Eaton— Surveys in Ohio.
Tomlinson—Edwards wished him to decline being cand: as Distr. Judge.
At the Capitol. close of Session of Congress— Mr Rush and Govr. Barbour came back with me.— Cambreleng.
Hobart— Has been very ill— Recommendation of Surveys
Bartlett. Politics of New-Hampshire— Woodbury’s obliquity.
Sloane— His Resn. a counterpart to Floyd’s. Meant to have joined them

list.head: Called in the Evening— I had retired to bed early owing to the great heat and did not see them

list.item: Strong, James— Much concerned about N.Y. Politics— Clintonian

div.p: 23. IV:20. Boat from Van Ness’s wharf— Dive and Swim to Rock Sun rose 4:46.

list.item: Garnsey. Navigation of St. Lawrence— Seneca Indians— Surveys.
Cocke.— For Houston and somebody’s papers which I gave him. t.t.l
Lowrie, with Sundry Resolutions from S.U.S. Asks copy of my Message.

list.head: Visits and t.t.l.
list.item: from Pa
Sanford— Visit t.t.l— We were interrupted. No conversation

list.head: Joseph Williams a Son of John’s in Tennessee
Biggs came with Mr Barton who took leave
list.item: Biggs of Illinois

list.head: Alabama Senators t.t.l. Pickens looks very ill— Has been able to attend in Senate only 6 days.

list.item: Lee. W.— to recommend O’Neal— for employment
Stephenson— Jas S. Pa. T.t.l— A friend quo ad hoc.
Marvin— Applies for a pardon for one Sheldon fraud on Revenue
Scott. John. Of Missouri. Asks of Bissell’s case. recomd. D. Atty. vice Bates
Taylor. J. W. Speaker t.t.l— Tallmadge’s Letters and Explann.
Markley— t.t.l— Has hopes of Pennsylvania— Abludit Imago—

list.head: t.t.l. Cambreleng delivered medals of the Canal celebration from the Corporation of N. York City.

list.item: Southard S.N. Papers of Armstrong. Marshal of Alabama.
Harleston. G. B— For a Midshipman’s warrant. Great Agitation.
Delegation of Florida Indians. M’Kenney— Humphreys
Taylor— J. W. dined with us. Spoke of rumours agt him— Says false
Johnson F. Evening t.t.l— Sloane has good news— Fahrt 90.

div.p: 24. IV:45. Boat with Antoine & John. Swam an hour.

list.item: Graham. G. with Proclamn. for Land Sales. Florida and Illinois
O’Neal— For employment in building the Penitentiary
Cook. D. P. Has been ill— His prospects indifferent.
Hendricks— Indian Treaty Coms.Ray, Tipton and Cass.
Rush S.T. Allowance to Regrs. and Receivers under new Act.
Lloyd— t.t.l.— going home— Interrupted— No Conversation.
Thomas— J. B. Political Prospects— Kane and Dickerson.

list.head: Mississippi Senators t.t.l.

list.item: Barbour S.W.— Unwell. Dr Sibley’s claim— M’Kenney Comr. Ind. Try.
Preuss— An old acquaintance. At St. P. Letter from Govr Kent.
M’Lean J. P.M.G. Petn. of C. Doolittle— Pilfered Post-Office.
Harleston— G. B.— Again for Midshipman’s Warrant. To Secy Navy.
Bailey— John— Political prospects— Elections to H.R.— Intrigues. V. B.

div.p: 25. IV:50.— With John and Antoine. Swam from Boat 30 minutes.

list.item: Barbour. James.— Insulting Letter from Forsyth— What to do?
Cutts— Charles. Late Secy S.U.S— For Navy-yard Store-Keepers Office
Bulfinch. Penitentiary Plans— To go to Auburn—W. Chester & Phila.
Test. of Indiana t.t.l— Political Prospects. He thinks favourable

list.head: t.t.l— Morton removing to Florida, with a hundred Slaves
list.item: Morton— of Va
Conway— of Arkansas t.t.l— wishes Lovely’s purchase surveyed
Jones— Coll. R. For confirmation of army appointments. Gl. Brown ill.
Stewart. A. t.t.l.— His Report on Internal Improvement.
Dr Hopkinson and John went for Baltimore.
I was unwell— North Bed chamber.

div.p: 26. VI:45. Walk round Square

list.item: Hunter— For his recommendatory papers, for Secy. Navy
Camac.— Chesapeake and Delaware Canal. Printed papers
Crowell. t.t.l. going to the Creek agency— Money paid in Council
M’Kee— t.t.l. returning to Alabama.
Rush S.T— Letter from C. J. Ingersoll. Chesapeake & D. Canal
Southard S.N. Lexington Sloop of War. to the fisheries.
Gallatin— A— Letter from Lawrence— Maine Boundary. N.W. Coast
Huntington. t.t.l. Letter recommending Daggett as Distr. judge

div.p: 27. V:15. With Antoine in Boat. Swam 55 minutes

list.item: Barbour S.W— Going home— No answer to Forsyth— Invitation.
Murdoch. David— Contribution for Presbyterian Church Winchester.
Conner. Captain B. Plan for removing Snags— Navy Departmt.
Owen. G. W— T.t.l— recovering and going home to Alabama
Blunt. Edward— For copies of Maps and Charts. Ordnance Dept
King of N. York— Agent— Papers concerning Fortifns. Staten Island.
Mercer. C. F— Papers concerning Slave smuggling in Alabama.
Gallatin and Mercer dined with us— Party at Mareuil’s.

div.p: 28. V:15. Boat with Antoine and George. Swam an hour.

list.item: Heard at St. John’s Church 1st. after Trin. Deut: 32
Gallatin— A— N.W. Coast. Slave Indemnity &c. he goes tomorrow
Heard Baker— Galatians 6.14.
Thunder Shower
Call at Clay’s— He is unwell— Reed’s circular.
Call at Genl. Brown’s— Convalescent. I only saw Mrs Brown.
John returned from Baltimore.

div.p: 29. III:30— Fire— Bowling’s house burnt down

list.item: Bissell— D— Going to Missouri— His Letter to the Secy of War
Van de Venter— With Bissell’s Letter— No answer necessary.
King. Coll. New-York. Took back Fortification papers, to be ment. next Message
Jones. Coll. R—Burnham & Thomas— Transfers from Marine Corps.

div.p: 30. IV:30. Sun rose 4:41.— Boat— Swam 40 minutes

list.item: Elgar— twice. Plan of the City— Penitentiary. the Point. E. Branch
Stanton. from R.I.— From Augusta Georgia. Visitor from Curiosity.
Brent. Danl.— Comn. to Wertz not sent. To be retained—
Seaton. W. W.— Applicant for Selden— Message to Southard S.N.

list.head:
Recommends Dinsmoor for Surveyor General Louisiana— Thinks Davis must be removed
Visitors of Curiosity
list.item: Richards of N.Y.
His Son.

list.head: By Steam-boat from Norfolk— Curiosity. Willits a Quaker from N. Jersey Anderson from Richmond
Lucchessi, comes Consul General from the king of the two Sicilies, and from Pope Leo 12. The Exequators issued this day— Luchessi was in Mexico
list.item: V.
Clay. S.S.— Impressment of the Seamen. Has written to G. Blake.
Southard S.N— Biddle Macedonian ready to Sail. Cattle Show Baltimore
Simms Mrs. from Alexandria for release of her Son from Jail.

div.p: 31. IV:35. Sun rose 4:42— Walk over Tyber to Bridge and Capitol—

list.item: Southard— S.N— Going to the Cattle Show. Took my Letter to Skinner—
Blunt. E— His Chart of N.Y. Harbour. Copies of Surveys at War-Office
Roberdeau Coll.— No Surveys at the Office. At H.R.— Chronometer
M’Kenney T. L. T.t.l. going on his Indian Treaty-Expedition
Little— Revd. R. Records and Diagrams of Patent-office.
Rush. S.T Letter from J. Binns. To remove Collr. Phila. for Markley.
Bailey. John— Going for home at the end of the week.
